alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Caribou Range; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 3:14PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WEAK AND DISCONTINUOUS LINE OF THUNDERSTORMS OVER THE SOUTHEAST HIGHLANDS MOVING SOUTHEAST THROUGH 415 PM MDT... At 310 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a weak and discontinuous line of thunderstorms extending from near Montpelier to near the Oneida Narrows Reservoir to 6 miles north of Malad to 7 miles northwest of Snowville, moving southeast at 5 mph toward those locals through 415 PM. HAZARD...Wind gusts to 35 mph and brief moderate rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds may cause issues with outdoor events and may pose a threat to boaters on Bear Lake and the Oneida Narrows Reservoir if they intensify. Locations impacted include... Preston, Montpelier, Malad, Swanlake, Dingle, Holbrook Summit, Oneida Narrows Reservoir, Pleasantview, Cherry Creek Rest Area, Paris, Dayton, Clifton, Bloomington, Oxford, Bern, Ovid, Liberty, Stone, Mink Creek and Samaria. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, know where to go if you need to seek shelter.

area.areaDesc: Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Caribou Range; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region
